title: Has the technology sector benefited from Donald Trump’s presidency? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Your kidding, right? Tech, from Google, Facebook, You Tube, Twitter, Drudge, NYT and the list is endless! They hate Trump and every fiber of his body. He, on the surface, doesn’t kowtow to the status quo, moves to better America and Americans, doesn’t cotton to the Swamp and fights Communism and the unrelenting Left every day. Tech owns everything. How in the hell have they benefited anymore than they already have except by being left alone to shut down everything that approves of Trump or the Right! High Tech Executives are wealthier than most third world country despots and , in point of fact wealthier than some small countries! Did they earn it? Did they deserve it? Yes and even more. It is just too bad that their ideology follows with the Progressive and Commie Left! We live in interesting times and may not much longer!

Your answers so far are episodic - it seems this or that! We won't know the answer overall for a few years assuming he is booted out in November metaphorically at least. Because if he is not and either stays in the WH or the people message is unclear, we won't know what benefits tech has seen relative to the before Trump and after Trump. The measured need to include; cash flow, revenues, employment, new product launches (very hard to measure) and rate of stock price change as compared to other sectors globally.

While there has been talk of anti-trust in tech, Trump has ignored that or looked the other way. Not supporting anti-trust cases against the media giants has indirectly helped themBy using Twitter as a bullypulpit Trump has legitimized the platformTrump was elected more than any other president in history based on technology media platforms, that increases their power.The work done by Cambridge Analytica showed what was possible with data collected from social media platforms. I’m sure there are now dozens of copycat businesses trying their hand.

All business sectors have benefited during the last four years. The tax cuts were like pouring gasoline on a smoldering fire and the economy roared to life. But now there are serious concerns about anti-trust involving the tech sector. And the economic conflict with China also dampens the prospects of tech companies. The big tech companies seem to have come to the conclusion that they would do better under a Biden administration that would improve relations with China and end the talk of anti-trust actions. The question is will that be better for the nation as a whole?

Wrong question (not by a little). How has America benefited from the Technology sector as a result of Trump is the only valid metric. A mixed bag there. The latest antitrust actions at the very end are a valuable start that Biden & Warren will certainly finish.

Two dogs and a pigeon could be president and that sector of business would continue what they have been doing… ignoring everything but their ability to continue to feed the rampant appetite of their rabid customers the tech they just “can’t” live without…. Any president that is dumb enough to think he/she can actually win a battle with that sector is sorely demented!!!! my 2cents!!
Evan, No one is going to gain any benefit from Trump’s presidency, except perhaps someone who wants to see the end of the human race.Keith.

All business sectors have benefited during the last four years. The tax cuts were like pouring gasoline on a smoldering fire and the economy roared to life. But now there are serious concerns about anti-trust involving the tech sector. And the economic conflict with China also dampens the prospects of tech companies.

I wouldn’t know since I’m not in that sector and it only has the slightest relevancy to my business but I don’t know if any business sector that hasn’t benefitted as a result of President Trumps actions since taking office.

What technology? Medical research appears to be moving at lightening speed. Virtual education had computers flying off the shelves. Virtual meeting and remote work programs are having a record growth year.

Both. Has delayed tech progress in the USA & improved it in China. Now we have iPhone (almost) 12 with likely no 120Hz refresh screen, late & many other cuts & restrictions due to tariffs & disastrous handling of the pandemics. Harmony OS is gaining momentum & Chinese tech is becoming more sophisticated & eventually dominant.
He has done more for the tech sector than people realize, including bringing the tech giants back to USA from their overseas tax havens.

i don’t think much has.many depend on slave labor for wide profit margins.they want to hook up with china but sell to the usa..they see citizen of the usa as customers and have no love for the usa,just money.

Why should it when most of it is anti_Trump? The tech sector wants their cheap Indian and chinese hi tech labor as before. Many of them are immigrants who don’t appreciate what America allowed them to do and become. THEy don’t help retrain American workers. They rather have their immigrants they can better control.
I know that since he failed so badly on the pandemic remote conference and remote learning has made some fast advances. So technically yes.
